definitions.definition: the crime of forcing somebody to have sex when they do not want it or are not able to agree to it

examples.text: an increase in the number of reported rapes
Rape has often been used as a weapon of war.

definitions.definition: the act of destroying an area or damaging its beauty in a way that seems unnecessary
a plant with bright yellow flowers, grown as food for farm animals and for its seeds that are used to make oil

wordOrigin: noun senses 1 to 2 late Middle English (originally denoting violent seizure of property, later carrying off a woman by force): from Anglo-Norman French rap (noun), raper (verb), from Latin rapere ‘seize’. noun sense 3 late Middle English (originally denoting the turnip plant): from Latin rapum, rapa ‘turnip’.
